## Research Artifact: Fines for Dirty Land in Rio de Janeiro

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

The Municipality of Rio de Janeiro has established procedures and legal frameworks for addressing the issue of dirty or unkempt private land, which can lead to fines for property owners. Citizens can report instances of neglected land through official channels, initiating a process that may result in penalties for non-compliance.

**Reporting and Notification Process:**
The Portal Carioca Digital, accessible via the 1746 service, allows residents to report irregular or dirty vacant land. This service aims to identify the property owner to issue a notification for the cleaning of the land, which includes the removal of garbage, debris, and other waste. If the owner fails to comply with this notification, fines can be applied [1]. The expected timeframe for the municipality to process such a notification is typically up to 15 business days [2].

**Owner Responsibility and Legal Basis for Fines:**
The primary responsibility for the maintenance and cleanliness of private land rests with the property owner [2]. The legal basis for imposing fines in such cases is primarily found in the urban cleaning legislation. Specifically, Lei n¬∫ 3.273, enacted on September 6, 2001, governs the urban cleaning system in Rio de Janeiro and provides for the imposition of fines on owners who do not adhere to cleaning notifications. [2]

Furthermore, Lei n¬∫ 1.630 of October 22, 1990, authorizes the Prefecture of Rio de Janeiro to undertake the construction of walls and sidewalks on vacant private land if the owner fails to do so after being notified. In such instances, the owner is responsible for the costs incurred by the municipality for the work performed and may also be subject to fines and other penalties stipulated by relevant legislation.
 [1]
**How to Report:**
Citizens can report neglected or dirty land by contacting the municipal services through the 1746 phone number or by using the 1746 Rio mobile application.
 [2]
**Relevant Legislation:**
*   **Lei n¬∫ 3.273/2001:** Regulates the urban cleaning system in Rio de Janeiro and outlines penalties for non-compliance with cleaning requirements for private properties.
* [2]   **Lei n¬∫ 1.630/1990:** Authorizes the municipality to perform necessary construction (walls, sidewalks) on neglected private land and to charge the owner for the costs, in addition to potential fines. [1]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/objetivo/notificar-limpeza-irregular-em-terreno-baldio/)
 - [2] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/servicos/notificacao-ao-proprietario-para-limpeza-de-residuos-em-terreno-baldio/)

## Research Artifact: Garbage Collection Days in Rio de Janeiro

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

The collection of household waste and recyclable materials in Rio de Janeiro is primarily managed by the Companhia Municipal de Limpeza Urbana (COMLURB), which is the largest public cleaning organization in Latin America [1]. To determine the specific days and times for garbage collection in any given neighborhood or street, residents are advised to consult official COMLURB resources.

### How to Find Collection Schedules

The most accurate and up-to-date information regarding collection schedules can be obtained through the following channels:

*   **COMLURB Website:** The official COMLURB website provides access to collection routes, days, and times for both regular household waste (coleta domiciliar) and recycling (coleta seletiva) [2]. Users can typically find this information by navigating to the "Servi√ßo" section and looking for "Coleta Domiciliar" or "Coleta Seletiva". [2]
*   **1746 Service:** The central atendimento for the Rio de Janeiro City Hall, known as 1746, can be contacted by phone at 1746 or (21) 3460-1746. This service can provide information and handle inquiries related to urban cleaning services. [2]
*   **Tele-Comlurb:** The Tele-Comlurb service is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week, and can be reached at 2204-9999 for service requests and information. [1]

### Types of Collection

Rio de Janeiro offers two main types of waste collection:

*   **Coleta Domiciliar (Regular Household Waste Collection):** This service handles general household waste. The frequency and schedule vary by neighborhood. [1] Some areas may have organic waste collected three times a week, on alternating days (e.g., Monday, Wednesday, Friday, or Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday), with collection times varying between daytime and nighttime. [1]
*   **Coleta Seletiva (Recycling Collection):** This service focuses on collecting recyclable materials such as metals, glass, plastic, and paper. The recycling collection typically occurs on specific days, alternating with the regular waste collection. [2] Residents are instructed to separate recyclable materials, often in transparent bags, and place them for collection at designated times. [3]

### Special Schedules and New Collection Models

*   **Holiday Adjustments:** COMLURB often implements special collection schedules during holidays, such as Christmas and New Year's Eve, with collections frequently being advanced to allow sanitation workers to celebrate with their families. [4] Residents are usually informed of these changes through distributed materials. [1]
*   **New Collection Models:** In some areas, new collection models are being introduced. These may involve residents storing waste in internal building containers and directly handing it over to collection trucks, aiming to prevent litter and street obstruction. [5]

For precise details pertaining to a specific address, consulting the official COMLURB resources or contacting the 1746 service is recommended.

**Sources:**
 - [1] [rio.rj.gov.br](http://www.rio.rj.gov.br/web/guest/exibeconteudo?id=4519128)
 - [2] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/articles/10734045483675-Informa%C3%A7%C3%A3o-sobre-Implanta%C3%A7%C3%A3o-de-coleta-seletiva)
 - [3] [prefeitura.rio](https://comlurb.prefeitura.rio/servico/coleta-domiciliar/)

**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

**Research Topic:** Denunciar lixo e entulho em cal√ßadas na Prefeitura do Rio de Janeiro.

To report instances of trash and debris on sidewalks in Rio de Janeiro to the city government, citizens can utilize the Central 1746 service. [1] This service acts as a primary point of contact for various municipal requests and complaints.

**Methods for Reporting:**
*   **Telephone:** Dial 1746 within Rio de Janeiro. For those outside the 21 area code, the number (21) 3460-1746 can be used. [1]
*   **Online Portal:** Access the official 1746 portal at www.1746.rio. [1]
*   **Mobile Application:** Download the "1746 Rio" application, available for both Android and iOS devices. [1]
*   **WhatsApp:** The service can also be contacted via WhatsApp at (21) 3460-1746. This number is specifically for WhatsApp communication and does not receive calls for service requests. [2]

**Process of Reporting:**
When a citizen contacts Central 1746, their request is received, understood, and meticulously registered. Subsequently, the request is forwarded to the relevant municipal body responsible for the service. For the removal of debris (entulho), the Companhia Municipal de Limpeza Urbana (COMLURB) is the designated authority. [1] COMLURB aims to complete the service within a specified timeframe, typically up to 10 working days for debris removal. [3]

**Information Required for Reporting:**
When making a report, it is advisable to provide comprehensive details to facilitate the process. This may include:
*   Full name. [3]
*   Contact phone number. [3]
*   Complete address of the occurrence, including street name, number, neighborhood, and any relevant reference points. [3]
*   A description of the material to be removed and its quantity, adhering to COMLURB's standards. [3]
*   Information regarding any difficulties that might impede the removal, such as lack of parking, no intercom, restricted access times for condominiums, ongoing construction, or the presence of stairs or ramps near the material. [3]
*   Clarification on whether the material is being removed from a house, building, or condominium, and if a resident is present. [3]

**Definition of Entulho:**
Entulho is defined as material from broken walls, cement, or broken tiles that can be bagged. [3]

**Limitations and Guidelines for Removal:**
COMLURB's free removal service has certain limitations:
*   It does not cover commercial, industrial, or service-providing units. [3]
*   Services are not provided for legal entities (pessoas jur√≠dicas).
 [3]*   Removal of debris from works carried out by contractors is not included.
 [3]*   Quantities exceeding COMLURB's specified limits will not be removed; in such cases, citizens should contract private companies accredited by COMLURB.
 [3]*   Debris should ideally be bagged in 20-liter plastic bags and placed in an easily accessible location without ramps or stairs.
 [3]*   A signature from a responsible person at the location may be required for the service order.
 [3]*   There is a waiting period of 12 days after a free removal service before a new request can be made, unless the previous request was canceled or not attended.
 [3]*   Separate requests must be made for debris removal and the removal of unwanted items (bens inserv√≠veis), even if both are within the permitted quantities.
* [3]   Removal services operate from 7 AM to 10 PM, Monday to Saturday, and do not occur on Sundays or holidays. [3]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [rio.rj.gov.br](http://www.rio.rj.gov.br/web/guest/exibeconteudo?id=7785294)
 - [2] [prefeitura.rio](https://prefeitura.rio/rio-faz/saiba-qual-e-o-novo-numero-de-whatsapp-do-1746-para-pedir-remocao-de-entulho-e-bens-inserviveis/)

**Research Artifact: Coleta Seletiva in Rio de Janeiro - Days and Locations**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

The selective collection service in Rio de Janeiro is managed by the Companhia Municipal de Limpeza Urbana (COMLURB), which aims to collect recyclable materials door-to-door on a weekly basis, on alternating days to the regular household waste collection [1]. To determine the specific days and times for a particular street, residents are advised to consult the official COMLURB website (comlurb.prefeitura.rio/servico/coleta-seletiva) or contact the tele-service at 2204-9999 or the central atendimento portal 1746 [2].

In addition to door-to-door collection, Rio de Janeiro also offers Points of Voluntary Drop-off (PEVs) for recyclable materials. These locations are strategically placed throughout the city to facilitate citizen participation in the selective collection program [3]. *   **Parada de Lucas:** Av. Brasil n¬∫ 13.550, in front of the viaduct, uphill lane. [3]
*   **Ilha do Governador:** Located in Comunidade do Dend√™ (Av. Paranapuan), Vila Joaniza (Estrada das Can√°rias), and Parque Royal (Av. Governador Chagas Freitas).
* [3]   **Botafogo:** Rua General Polidoro, n¬∫ 65.
*  [3]  **Penha:** Rua Merindiba, s/n¬∫, near the Church of Penha.
*   [3] **Tijuca:** Rua Dr. Renato Rocco, 400.

*   * [3]*G√°vea:** Galp√£o das Artes Urbanas, in front of the Planet√°rio (Av. Padre Leonel Franca, S/N).

Most PEVs [4] operate from 9 am to 6 pm, with some potentially being accessible 24 hours a day.

**Materials [3] to Separate:**
The selective collection accepts a range of recyclable materials, including:
*   **Metals:** Aluminum, copper, lead, wires, bronze, cans, and small metal scraps.

It is important [2] that recyclable materials are clean and placed in transparent plastic bags.

**Materials [2] Not Collected by COMLURB's Selective Collection:**
Certain items are not collected through the standard selective collection service and require separate disposal methods. These include:
*   Lamps (fluorescent lamps should be returned to the point of sale).

*   Oils [2] (cooking and lubricating).
*   Organic [4] waste (should be placed for regular household collection).
*   Electronic [2] waste.

The selective [4] collection program is a partnership that directs collected materials to cooperatives of waste pickers, fostering employment and income generation within the community. For any doubts [3] or further information, residents can contact 1746 or (21) 3460-1746. [4]

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

The process for obtaining an environmental license for the construction of a warehouse in Rio de Janeiro involves several steps and requires specific documentation, managed by the municipal government [1]. The Secretaria Municipal de Meio Ambiente (SMAC) was historically responsible for issuing environmental licenses for activities of local environmental impact, a role that began following a convention in 2007 [1]. Currently, the process for new environmental licensing applications is handled digitally through the Sistema Eletr√¥nico de Documentos e Processos ‚Äì Processo.Rio. The [2] Secretaria Municipal de Desenvolvimento Urbano e Econ√¥mico (SMDUE) is also involved in licensing matters.

* [3]*Types of Environmental Licenses:**
The municipal environmental licensing system in Rio de Janeiro includes various types of licenses, depending on the nature, scale, and phase of the project:
*  [1]  **Licen√ßa Municipal Pr√©via (LMP):** This is the initial document issued during the planning phase, confirming the project's environmental viability and establishing basic requirements and conditions for subsequent stages.
*    [1]**Licen√ßa Municipal de Instala√ß√£o (LMI):** This license authorizes the installation of the project after the LMP requirements are met.
*   **Licen√ßa [1] Municipal de Opera√ß√£o (LMO):** Issued after the installation phase, this license permits the operation of the activity, provided that all environmental control measures and conditions are effectively implemented.
*   **Licen√ßa [1] Municipal Simplificada (LMS):** This is a single-phase license for small-scale activities with low environmental impact, as defined in specific decrees.
*   **Licen√ßa [1] Municipal de Instala√ß√£o e Opera√ß√£o (LMIO):** This license can be granted before the project's implementation and authorizes both installation and operation for activities classified as having low environmental impact.

**Scope of Municipal [3] Licensing:**
Municipal environmental licensing applies to projects and activities with a local environmental impact. Projects that require [1] a full Environmental Impact Study (EIA) and its corresponding Environmental Impact Report (RIMA), or those situated in natural preservation areas, fall under the jurisdiction of the state environmental agency.

**Application Process [1] and Documentation:**
To initiate the licensing process, an applicant must submit a formal Requerimento de Licenciamento Ambiental. ## Research Artifact: Prohibition and Reporting of Backyard Trash Burning in Rio de Janeiro

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

Burning trash in backyards within the municipality of Rio de Janeiro is prohibited by law due to its environmental and health impacts [1]. This practice is considered an environmental crime under both federal and municipal legislation [1].

**Legal Basis for Prohibition:**

*   **Lei N¬∫ 7451/2022** explicitly forbids the use of fire for cleaning and soil preparation, which includes the burning of branches, fallen leaves, domestic waste, and other materials throughout the municipality. [1] This law aims to combat environmental pollution and prevent fires. [2]
*   The **Lei de Crimes Ambientais (Federal Law n¬∫ 9.605/1998)**, particularly Article 54, classifies pollution as a crime. Causing pollution that endangers human health, animal safety, or destroys flora, which includes the smoke and hazards from burning trash, is punishable.
 [1]
**Penalties for Violations:**

Individuals found in violation of these regulations face penalties. For a first offense, a notification is issued. In cases of recidivism, a fine of R$ 500.00 may be imposed. For legal entities, the initial penalty is a notification, followed by a fine of R$ 2,000.00, which is doubled for each subsequent infraction. These [1] measures are in place to protect the environment, public health, and prevent the spread of fires.
 [1]
**Reporting Violations:**

Citizens who witness or wish to report instances of backyard trash burning in Rio de Janeiro have several channels available:

*   **Central 1746:** This is the primary municipal service for reporting environmental issues, including queimadas (burnings). The environmental patrol conducts inspections based on citizen requests made through this central. The [3] service can be accessed via phone (1746 within Rio de Janeiro, or (21) 3460-1746 from other locations), the 1746 Rio app, or the portal www.1746.rio.
 [4]*   **Linha Verde ‚Äì Disque Den√∫ncia Ambiental:** This environmental hotline can be reached at (21) 2253-1177 or 0300 253 1177. Denunciations can be made anonymously, including via WhatsApp.
*   [2] **Disque Den√∫ncia RJ App:** Citizens can also use the dedicated app to report environmental crimes.
*    [5]**Disque Den√∫ncia Website:** Reports can be submitted through the website www.disquedenuncia.org.br.
*   * [5]*Linha Verde Facebook Page:** The program also maintains a presence on Facebook at www.facebook.com/linhaverdedd.
*   * [5]*Environmental Police:** For direct reporting or information, the Comando de Policiamento Ambiental (CPAM) can be contacted at Av. Itaoca, n¬∞ 1618, or by phone at (21) 2334-7637.
*   **Other [1] Authorities:** Depending on the specific nature of the incident, reporting to the Federal Police (for highway-related issues), Ibama, or the State environmental agencies may also be appropriate. In cases [1] of active fires, the Fire Department (193) should be contacted immediately. [1]

**Sources:**

**Research Artifact: Authorization for Property Demolition in Rio de Janeiro**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

To obtain authorization for demolishing a property in Rio de Janeiro, a formal process involving the municipal government is required. This process ensures that demolitions are conducted in compliance with technical, environmental, and safety regulations [1]. Demolishing a property without the necessary permit can lead to fines, embargoes, and legal complications [1].

**Process for Obtaining Demolition Authorization:**

The primary pathway for obtaining a demolition license is through the Portal Carioca Digital, specifically via the "Requerimento Online" system [2]. The property owner must be registered on this platform to initiate the request [2].

Key steps and requirements include:

1.  **Ownership Verification:** The applicant must be the legal owner of the property. Proof of ownership, such as a property registration certificate (Certid√£o de Registro de im√≥veis), is a mandatory document.
2 [2].  **Professional Responsibility:** The demolition project must be overseen by a qualified professional, such as an engineer or architect, who is registered with the relevant regional council (CREA/RJ or CAU/RJ). This [2] professional is responsible for the project and the execution of the demolition, often requiring an Anota√ß√£o de Responsabilidade T√©cnica (ART) or Registro de Responsabilidade T√©cnica (RRT).
3.   [2]**Project Submission:** A detailed demolition project must be prepared and submitted. This project should outline the methodology for demolition, identify potential risks, and specify protective measures for surrounding areas and properties.
4.   [1]**Documentation:** Specific documents are required for the application, which may include:
    *   Two 5x12 cm photographs of the property, particularly for demolitions in specific planning areas or for properties built before 1937.
     [2]*   Copies of the professional identification (CREA/RJ or CAU/RJ) of the responsible project and execution professionals.
     [2]*   A declaration as per Article 3 of Decree 23235 of 04/08/2003.
     [2]*   Proof of property ownership (Certid√£o de Registro de im√≥veis).
    *  [2]  In some cases, environmental permits may be necessary, especially if the demolition generates hazardous waste or is located in environmentally sensitive areas.
5.  **Application [3] Submission:** The application and all supporting documents are typically submitted digitally through the Requerimento Online system on the Portal Carioca Digital. For existing [2] processes, requests can be submitted through the same system.
6.  **Review [3] and Approval:** The municipal authority will review the submitted project and documentation. If approved, a demolition license (Alvar√° de Demoli√ß√£o) will be issued, specifying timelines for the commencement and completion of the work. The expected [1] timeframe for license issuance is approximately 30 days.
7.  **Post [2]-Demolition Acceptance:** After the demolition is completed, an acceptance of the demolition works may be issued, confirming the finalization of the process.

**Important [2] Considerations:**

*   **Total Demolition:** The demolition license is generally issued for the entirety of the property. Partial demolitions are not covered by a standard demolition license and must be handled as a modification with a decrease in area.
*   **Legal [2] Compliance:** It is crucial to adhere to all legal requirements and obtain the necessary permits before commencing any demolition work to avoid penalties.
*   **Irregular [1] Constructions:** The Prefeitura do Rio de Janeiro actively conducts operations to demolish illegal constructions and enforce urbanistic regulations. Properties with unregularized expansions or constructions may face demolition if they do not comply with the law or pursue regularization options like the "Lei da Mais Valia".

The process [4] is managed by the Secretaria Municipal de Desenvolvimento Urbano e Licenciamento (SMDU). For inquiries [4] or assistance, citizens can contact the central service by dialing 1746 or using the 1746 Rio application. [2]

**Sources:**

 - [2] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/servicos/licenca-de-demolicao-de-edificacao/)
 - [3] [rio.rj.gov.br](https://requerimentossmu.rio.rj.gov.br/)
 - [4] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/grupo/licenciar-obras/)

**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

**Research Topic:** Denunciar obra irregular prefeitura rio de janeiro

**Summary:**

To report an irregular construction in the city of Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels provided by the municipal government. The Central 1746 is a primary point of contact for receiving such denouncements and operates 24 hours a day, seven days a week [1]. This service is also accessible via WhatsApp, where citizens can send messages, including audio and images, to the number 98909-1746 to report irregular construction activities [2]. The Portal Carioca Digital also serves as a platform for reporting irregular construction, specifically mentioning fiscalization of works in invaded areas and communities [3].

The Central 1746 handles a wide range of urbanism-related inquiries and denouncements, including those concerning unlicensed, embargoed, or unplastered constructions, as well as "puxadinhos" (unauthorized additions) and constructions in communities [1]. The scope of these fiscalizations covers various types of constructions, including loteamentos (subdivisions), constructions on public land, new house constructions (with or without deforestation), and works on listed buildings [2].

For citizens seeking to make a denouncement, it is advised to provide as much identifying information as possible about the location of the irregular work, such as the address, and any details that can help identify the property or owner [2]. The information gathered through these channels is then forwarded to the relevant divisions within the municipal government, such as the Secretaria Municipal de Ordem P√∫blica (SEOP) or the Divis√£o de Fiscaliza√ß√£o de Obras (DIFOP), for verification and action.

The [3] municipal government emphasizes its commitment to collaborative and participatory management, utilizing popular tools like WhatsApp to facilitate citizen engagement in identifying and addressing urban irregularities. The [2] 1746 service is available via phone, its own mobile application, and through the websites www.1746.rio.gov.br and http://carioca.rio.rj.gov.br. The [2] Ouvidoria (Ombudsman) serves as a second instance for complaints regarding services that were not resolved within the expected timeframe or quality. [1]

### Research Artifact

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

**Research Topic:** Denunciar obra irregular prefeitura Rio de Janeiro

**Summary:**

To report an irregular construction in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels provided by the city hall. The Central 1746 is a primary point of contact for receiving such complaints and operates 24 hours a day, seven days a week [1]. This service is also accessible via WhatsApp, where citizens can send messages, including audio and images, with detailed information about the irregular construction to identify the location accurately [2]. The Central 1746 also handles inquiries related to the Municipal Secretariat of Urbanism [1].

The Portal Carioca Digital is another platform where citizens can report irregular constructions, specifically mentioning fiscalization of works in invaded areas or unauthorized constructions [3]. The Secretaria Municipal de Ordem P√∫blica (SEOP) is involved in combating irregular constructions, working in cooperation with the Public Prosecutor's Office to address urban disorder and punish those responsible. [4]

For specific issues related to professional practice in engineering, agronomy, and geosciences, the CREA-RJ is the responsible body for fiscalization. However, CREA-RJ clarifies that issues such as safety risks in buildings, recuances of works, invasion of neighboring land, and delivery of permits fall under the purview of the Municipal Secretariat of Urbanism or the Civil Defense, not CREA-RJ. [4]

The Municipal Secretariat of Urban Development and Licensing (SMDU) also provides channels for information and denouncements, with their headquarters located at Rua Afonso Cavalcanti, 455, Cidade Nova, Rio de Janeiro/RJ. [3] The general phone number for doubts, services, information, or denouncements is 1746, or (21) 3460-1746 for areas outside of Rio de Janeiro. [3]

When making a report, it is crucial to provide as much information as possible, including the location, address, and owner's name, to facilitate the investigation. [2] The types of constructions that can be reported include those without licenses, those under embargo, those without signage, unauthorized extensions ("puxadinhos"), and constructions in communities, as well as middle or high-class constructions, subdivisions, constructions on public land, new houses with or without deforestation, and works on listed buildings. [2]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [prefeitura.rio](https://prefeitura.rio/cidade/central-1746-recebe-denuncias-de-obras-irregulares/)

one_turn_analysis.agent_message:
Ol√°! O *Habite-se* √© um documento emitido pela Prefeitura que comprova que sua constru√ß√£o est√° de acordo com as normas municipais e pode ser habitada.

*Como tirar:*
1.  **Re√∫na a documenta√ß√£o**: Inclui o *Alvar√° de constru√ß√£o aprovado*, *Certid√£o negativa de d√©bitos municipais*, *Planta baixa atualizada e aprovada*, e um *Laudo t√©cnico* de engenheiro/arquiteto.
2.  **Protocolo**: Fa√ßa a solicita√ß√£o formal na Prefeitura.

**Research Topic:** Regulariza√ß√£o de obra puxadinho prefeitura rio de janeiro

The regularization of informal building extensions, commonly known as "puxadinhos," in Rio de Janeiro is facilitated by municipal legislation, popularly referred to as the "Lei dos Puxadinhos." This framework allows for the licensing and legalization of constructions and additions to existing buildings through the payment of a fee to the municipality, a mechanism often termed "mais-valia".
 [1]
**Key Legislative Updates and Deadlines:**
The "Lei dos Puxadinhos" has undergone recent legislative changes. Initially approved in 2023 and effective from July 2024, its validity expired in December 2024. A [1] new law, Projeto de Lei Complementar 2/25, was approved by the Municipal Chamber of Rio de Janeiro on May 15, 2025, extending and modifying the rules for regularization. Under [1] these updated provisions, the deadlines for submitting regularization requests are:
*   For projects of works not yet initiated: December 1, 2025.
 [1]*   For works already constructed by the law's publication date: June 30, 2026.
 [1]
**Scope of Regularization:**
The "Lei dos Puxadinhos" permits the regularization of various types of construction and modifications, including:
*   **Building extensions**: This covers the construction of an additional floor of a rooftop, provided it does not exceed half the area of the last existing floor. It [1] also allows for horizontal expansions in uncovered areas at any level and on legalized or planned rooftop floors.
 [2]*   **Transformations of building use**: Hotels can be converted into residential buildings, with the exception of those located on the city's waterfront.
 [1]*   **Height equalization**: Properties in specific neighborhoods, such as Catete and Gl√≥ria, are permitted to be extended to match the height of adjacent taller buildings.
* [1]   **Commercial and non-residential expansions**: Buildings used for commercial purposes can expand their spaces for shops and services, respecting maximum height regulations. Companies [1] with legally recognized properties can also expand their structures.
* [1]   **Balcony modifications**: Homeowners can close balconies, subject to a fee, as long as the enclosed space is not divided into new rooms. Balconies [3] can also occupy setback areas, provided they do not have windows facing neighbors and a fee is paid.
* [3]   **Commercial property enhancements**: Mezzanines can be incorporated into commercial areas up to the limits defined by the building code, and balconies are not counted towards the calculation of built area for commercial properties.

 [3]**Process and Requirements:**
To regularize a "puxadinho," property owners typically need to submit an application through the online "Requerimento Online" system managed by the Municipal Secretariat of Urbanism (SMU). The [3] process generally requires the following documentation:
*   Proof of property dimensions, such as a Property Registration Certificate (Certid√£o de √înus Reais - RGI) or an approved subdivision project.
*   [4] An architectural project detailing the construction.
*   [4] Documentation from the responsible professionals (architects or engineers), such as their CREA/CAU cards.
*   [4] A technical analysis and a "Laudo de Contrapartida" (fee assessment) will be generated, calculating the amount payable to the municipality based on the building's characteristics, area, and local property values.

**Payment [5] and Financial Aspects:**
The regularization process involves paying a "contrapartida" or "mais-valia" fee to the municipality. For [3] properties located in the North and West Zones of Rio de Janeiro, this fee can be paid in installments, potentially up to 60 times without interest. Historically [1], discounts have been offered for upfront payments, though current specific discount percentages are not detailed in the most recent search results.

**Exemptions [3]:**
Certain entities are exempt from paying the regularization fee. These include public facilities of collective interest and areas used by religious temples that benefit from tax immunity.

**Consequences [2] of Non-Compliance:**
Failure to regularize unauthorized constructions can lead to significant penalties. Property owners found to have unlicensed works are subject to municipal inspection, which can result in notifications, fines, inclusion in active debt records, and even demolition of the irregular structures. Recent [1] enforcement actions in areas like Barra da Tijuca have seen demolitions of commercial properties that had expressed interest in regularization but failed to complete the process, often due to substantial outstanding debts.

**Official [2] Information Channels:**
For detailed information and to initiate the regularization process, citizens are directed to the official channels of the Rio de Janeiro City Hall, including the SMU website and the 1746 citizen service portal. [1]

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

The zoning regulations in Rio de Janeiro define parameters for land use and occupation, aiming for balanced and sustainable urban development. These regulations are primarily governed by the City's Master Plan (Plano Diretor) and the Law of Land Parceling, Use, and Occupation of the Soil (Lei de Uso e Ocupa√ß√£o do Solo - LUOS). The [1] most recent comprehensive legislation referenced is Lei Complementar (LC) 270/2024, which establishes the macrozonas, zones, and subzones of the city and outlines permitted uses and occupation parameters.
 [2]
**Key Legislation and Resources:**

*   **Lei Complementar (LC) 270/2024:** This law, published on January 18, 2024, revises the Master Plan for Sustainable Urban Development of the Municipality of Rio de Janeiro. It defines the macrozonas, zones, and subzones, and sets the parameters for land parceling, soil occupation, and permitted uses within the municipality. The [2] DATA RIO platform provides access to maps and data services related to this zoning.
 [2]*   **Lei de Uso e Ocupa√ß√£o do Solo (LUOS):** This law consolidates principles and guidelines for the use and occupation of urban space. It aims to ensure balanced development, considering existing and planned infrastructure, environmental restrictions, landscape, and cultural environment. The [1] LUOS also standardizes zoning and parameters for land, defines important commercial and service centers based on accessibility and economic impact, and sets criteria for sidewalk occupation.
*  [1]  **Portal Carioca Digital:** This platform offers various services related to urban planning and legislation, including a "Consulta Pr√©via de Local" (Prior Local Consultation) that allows users to check if a proposed economic activity is permitted according to zoning and land use laws. It also [3] provides access to "Legisla√ß√£o Bairro a Bairro" (Neighborhood-by-Neighborhood Legislation) through a georeferenced application for consulting land use and occupation laws and issuing Urban Information Reports (RIU).
*   * [3]*DATA RIO:** This platform serves as a repository for urban data, including zoning maps and services based on LC 270/2024, providing a visual representation of the city's zoning.

**General [2] Principles of Zoning:**

*   **Purpose:** Zoning aims to define what is most suitable for each area of the city, considering its specific characteristics and needs, to ensure adequate land use, social and economic development, environmental protection, and improved quality of life.
*   * [1]*Zoning Categories:** The municipal territory is divided into zones, which are characterized by the predominance, diversity, or intensity of various uses and economic, social, and cultural activities. These laws have extended deadlines for regularization and also address specific conversions, such as prohibiting the conversion of beachfront hotels into residential buildings in certain areas.

When filing a complaint regarding sidewalk occupation by commercial activities, such as food stalls, it is important to provide specific details. These include the type of establishment and its economic activity, the complete address (street, neighborhood, and number), the days and times of the occupation, and the specific public area being occupied (e.g., sidewalk, square). The process of fiscalization involves notifying and issuing fines for irregular occupations. [1] However, the seizure of goods or equipment depends on the conclusion of the inspection process and may require the support of other municipal bodies. [1] While the CCU conducts these inspections, it is noted that the fiscalization cannot guarantee the immediate or 24-hour-a-day desocupation of sidewalks. [1] For issues related to noise disturbances, a separate subtype, "Perturba√ß√£o do sossego," should be used.

### Research Artifact: Reporting Noise Complaints in Rio de Janeiro

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

To report noise complaints in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels provided by the municipality. The primary method for reporting disturbances related to "perturba√ß√£o do sossego" (disturbance of the peace) is through the **1746** service, which is the central customer service for the City Hall of Rio de Janeiro. This [1] service can be accessed via telephone, the 1746.rio portal, or the 1746 Rio mobile application. The [2] Guarda Municipal do Rio de Janeiro (GM-Rio) is responsible for enforcing regulations related to noise disturbances caused by establishments such as religious temples, bars, nightclubs, restaurants with music, dance halls, clubs, and garage signaling devices.
 [2]
For issues related to "polui√ß√£o sonora" (noise pollution) stemming from activities requiring environmental licensing, such as industries, workshops, construction sites, and certain commercial activities, the **Secretaria Municipal de Meio Ambiente da Cidade (SMAC)** is the responsible body. The [1] SMAC conducts noise measurements for environmentally licensed businesses and activities managed by GEM Rio Luz.

* [1]*Channels for Reporting Noise Complaints:**

*   **Central 1746:** This is the main point of contact for most noise complaints, including those related to "perturba√ß√£o do sossego".
     [1]*   **Phone:** 1746 (local calls) or (21) 3460-1746.
     [1]*   **Online Portal:** 1746.rio and carioca.rio.
     [2]*   **WhatsApp:** (21) 3460-1746.
     [2]*   **Mobile Application:** 1746 Rio.

*   [2] **Secretaria Municipal de Meio Ambiente da Cidade (SMAC):** For noise pollution from activities requiring environmental licensing.

**Types [1] of Noise Disturbances and Responsible Agencies:**

*   **Perturba√ß√£o do Sossego:** This category includes noise from religious temples, bars, nightclubs, restaurants with music, dance halls, clubs, and garage signaling devices. The **Guarda Municipal (GM-Rio)** handles these complaints, accessible via the 1746 service.
*   **Polui√ß√£o [2] Sonora (Environmental Licensing):** This covers noise from activities requiring environmental licenses, such as industries, workshops, construction sites, and similar operations. The **Secretaria Municipal de Meio Ambiente (SMAC)** is responsible for these, with services accessible through the 1746 portal.

**Specific [1] Exclusions and Alternative Actions:**

*   The GM-Rio does not handle noise from construction sites, industrial activities, or commercial/industrial activities requiring environmental licensing; these fall under the purview of the SMAC.
*   Noise [2] from "bailes funks" should be reported to the Military Police by calling **190**.
*   For issues [2] related to traffic noise, vehicle sounds (motors, alarms), or public service vehicles, specific reporting channels may apply, but the 1746 service is a general point of contact.
*   In cases [2] of immediate danger or severe disturbances, contacting the Military Police via **190** is also an option.
*   For complaints [2] related to vendors, population in street situations, or specific types of public works, other specific channels within the Ouvidoria or relevant secretariats should be used.
*   The  [2]"Patrulha Ambiental" (Environmental Patrol) handles environmental issues like water, air, and soil pollution but does not cover noise pollution.

**Legal [3] Framework and Sanctions:**

The reporting and enforcement of noise disturbances are based on Municipal Law 6.179 of May 22, 2017, and its regulatory decrees, including Decree No. 51.136 of July 12, 2022. Sanctions [2] for violations can include fines ranging from R$ 545.93 to R$ 5,459.93, with penalties doubled for legal entities in case of recidivism. Establishments may also face partial or total interdiction and revocation of their operating licenses.

**Evidence [4] for Complaints:**

For complaints to be more effective, producing a technical acoustic report (laudo ac√∫stico) by a qualified professional is recommended, as it documents noise levels, times, and frequency, aiding in substantiating the infraction. In cases involving [2] the police, the officer's observation can serve as evidence.

**Note:* [2]* The information regarding the "Patrulha Ambiental" phone number (2498-1001) is from 2008 and may not be current for noise complaints. The primary [3] and most up-to-date channels are the 1746 service and the SMAC, as detailed above.

The Municipal Secretariat for Animal Protection and Defense (SMPDA) and the Municipal Health Surveillance and Zoonosis Control Subsecretariat are key bodies involved in these efforts.

**Animal Collection and Rescue:**
The city's animal control services, including the Center for Zoonosis Control, are responsible for rescuing animals from public streets. These animals are then cared for, sterilized, and, depending on their age and behavior, made available for adoption. **Addressing Aggressive Animals and Public Safety:**
While the search results do not directly detail a specific program for "collecting street animals advancing on people," the general framework for animal control and public health surveillance addresses such concerns. The Municipal Health Surveillance and Zoonosis Control Subsecretariat is involved in managing zoonoses and provides information regarding aggressive or attacking dogs and cats. [2] The 1746 service, a central point of contact for citizens, handles various public services, including those related to animals. Denunciations of animal mistreatment or animals in poor conditions can be made through this channel. [3]

**Public Health and Zoonoses Control:**
The city's health departments are involved in managing zoonoses, which includes addressing potential risks from animals. This includes providing information and services related to rabies prevention, with the Rio de Janeiro municipality being among those with the highest number of rabies-related treatments. tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

**Research Topic:** Permitted construction noise hours in Rio de Janeiro

In Rio de Janeiro, the regulation of construction noise and working hours is primarily guided by municipal laws and decrees aimed at controlling noise pollution and ensuring public peace. While there isn't a single, overarching municipal law that dictates a universal start or end time for all construction activities, specific regulations apply to the use of certain equipment and types of work.

For the operation of heavy equipment such as pile drivers and jackhammers, the permitted hours are between 10:00 AM and 5:00 PM on weekdays [1]. The city's approach to noise pollution is based on Municipal Law No. 3.268 of August 29, 2001, amended by Law No. 3.342 of December 28, 2001, and further detailed by Decree No. 29.881 of September 18, 2008, which includes Regulation No. 2 concerning Protection Against Noise [1]. This framework categorizes permissible noise levels based on the time of day and the specific zoning of the area. Generally, daytime is considered from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM, during which noise levels are more permissive, while nighttime, from 10:00 PM to 7:00 AM, has more restrictive limits [1]. On Sundays and holidays, the daytime period extends from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM [1].

Specific regulations also exist for the use of explosives in construction. For general civil works involving explosives, the permitted hours are between 10:00 AM and 3:00 PM on weekdays [1]. Similarly, for activities like pile driving that cannot be enclosed, the hours are set between 10:00 AM and 5:00 PM on weekdays, provided that adequate noise control measures are implemented at the source or along the path of the sound [1].

The "Lei do Sil√™ncio" (Silence Law), while often associated with entertainment venues, also extends its purview to other noise sources, including construction, to safeguard public tranquility and well-being. [2] Non-compliance with these noise regulations can result in penalties such as fines, which can range from R$ 500 to R$ 5000, and potentially lead to the embargo of construction projects. [1]

For public works, some activities may be scheduled during nighttime hours to minimize disruption to traffic flow. [1] Citizens experiencing excessive construction noise can report such issues through the 1746 platform or the official website of the Rio de Janeiro City Hall. [3]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/articles/10835009527707-Informa%C3%A7%C3%B5es-sobre-os-hor%C3%A1rios-permitidos-para-execu%C3%A7%C3%A3o-de-obras)
 - [2] [metroform.com.br](https://metroform.com.br/blog/horario-obra-construcao-civil/)
 - [3] [youtube.com](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lacWm1fya-A)

## Research Artifact: Scheduling a Divorce Appointment with the Public Defender's Office in Rio de Janeiro

The Public Defender's Office (Defensoria P√∫blica) in Rio de Janeiro offers several channels for citizens to schedule appointments, including for divorce proceedings. The primary methods involve online services, a dedicated mobile application, and in-person attendance.

### Scheduling Channels and Procedures

For non-urgent matters, including scheduling appointments and inquiring about ongoing processes, online assistance is available on weekdays between 10:00 AM and 5:00 PM. [1]

Urgent cases, such as those involving a risk to life, child apprehension, burial permits, domestic violence, or immediate arrest, require contacting the Judiciary Plant√£o. This can be done via phone at 129 or through the "Defensoria RJ" mobile application during weekdays from 11:00 AM to 6:00 PM. After 6:00 PM, urgent cases can still be addressed through the "Defensoria RJ" app or by emailing dpplantao@defensoria.rj.def.br.
 [1]
The "Defensoria RJ" mobile application serves as a comprehensive tool for accessing the institution's services. Users can schedule both remote and in-person appointments, submit necessary documentation, track existing appointments, and communicate directly with the Defensoria. To [2] utilize the app, individuals must register using their CPF, full name, email address, and create a password. The [2] app guides users through the process of selecting the reason for their appointment, answering relevant questions, choosing a service location (municipality and neighborhood), reviewing required documentation, and confirming the appointment.
 [3]
For those who prefer in-person service, the process begins by providing your CPF. The [1] general operating hours for in-person attendance are weekdays from 7:00 AM to 12:00 PM, excluding holidays. It [1] is important to note that the Defensoria P√∫blica announced that public attendance scheduling would resume on January 7, 2025, following the judicial recess.

 [1]### Divorce Proceedings: Required Documents and Location

To initiate a divorce case with the Defensoria P√∫blica, applicants must present several documents, typically in their original format. These [4] include:
*   An updated marriage certificate, issued within the last six months.
*  [4]  A valid RG (identity card) or professional identification card.
*  [4]  CPF (Cadastro de Pessoas F√≠sicas).
*   [4] A copy of the most recent income tax return, which is mandatory to demonstrate low-income status and eligibility for free legal aid.
*   [4] Proof of income, such as a payslip, professional ID, or a declaration signed by an employer or professional union, to verify the right to free justice.
*   [4] Proof of residence in the applicant's name, which can include utility bills issued within the last three months, correspondence from private companies or public bodies dated within three months, a declaration from a residents' association dated within three months, a current rental agreement, or a declaration accompanied by an ID and one of the aforementioned documents.
*   [4] Birth certificates of any children, or previous marriage certificates if applicable.
*   [4] If there are assets to be divided, documentation pertaining to these assets (movable or immovable) and their estimated market value is required.

The [4] Defensoria P√∫blica will also request any other documents deemed necessary by the Public Defender during the course of the consultation, and may require document authentication. Divorce [4] services are typically provided at the Family Nucleus corresponding to the user's residence.

### [4] Eligibility for Services

The Defensoria P√∫blica generally serves individuals whose family income does not exceed three times the minimum wage. However, victims of domestic violence are eligible for assistance regardless of their income level.

The administrative [3] headquarters of the Defensoria P√∫blica do Rio de Janeiro are located at Avenida Marechal C√¢mara, 314 - Centro, RJ. For citizen assistance, the contact number is 129. [4]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [ac.def.br](https://agendamento.ac.def.br/)
 - [2] [youtube.com](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FIV-Uky6Hac)
 - [3] [rj.def.br](https://defensoria.rj.def.br/AutoAtendimento/Divorcio)
 - [4] [rj.def.br](https://www.defensoria.rj.def.br/Cidadao/Atendimento-On-line)

**Research Artifact: Filing a Complaint with PROCON RJ for a Broken TV**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

Consumers in Rio de Janeiro seeking to file a complaint regarding a broken TV or other product issues can utilize the services of PROCON RJ (State Consumer Protection and Defense Program) and PROCON Carioca (Municipal Consumer Protection and Defense Institute) [1].

**Methods for Filing a Complaint:**

1.  **PROCON RJ Online:**
    *   Complaints can be registered through the PROCON Online system, accessible via the website `proconline.rj.gov.br` [2].
    *   The online service is available on weekdays from 7 AM to 10 PM [3].
    *   While the online platform is designed for computer use, it is recommended to download the PROCON-RJ application for filing complaints via mobile devices [1].
    *   After filing, consumers can track the progress of their complaint using a provided protocol number [1]. The online demands are processed on business days between 9 AM and 6 PM, in the order they are received [1].

2.  **PROCON Carioca:**
    *   For issues within the municipality of Rio de Janeiro, PROCON Carioca can be contacted.
    *   Complaints can be initiated by calling 1746 (within Rio de Janeiro) or (21) 3460-1746 (from other locations) [3]. Alternatively, complaints can be opened directly through the 1746 portal by filling out a form [4].
    *   Upon receiving a complaint, PROCON Carioca analyzes the issue, registers it in the national consumer system (Proconsumidor), and notifies the company involved to seek an amicable resolution within 10 calendar days [4].

3.  **Ouvidoria (PROCON RJ):**
    *   The Ouvidoria serves as a channel for consumers to submit complaints, suggestions, denunciations, or compliments regarding PROCON-RJ services.
    *   Contact can be made via email at `ouvidoriaproconrj@gmail.com` or by phone at (21) 2216-8686 [1].

4.  **In-Person Service (PROCON RJ):**
    *   For in-person assistance, consumers can visit PROCON RJ at Av. Rio Branco, 25, 4th floor.
    *   The office is open from Monday to Friday, between 9 AM and 5 PM [1].
    *   It is noted that for certain requests, such as obtaining a payment slip, a prior appointment is required [1].

**Required Information and Documentation:**

To file a complaint, consumers typically need to provide the following:
*   The name and address of the company against which the complaint is being made [3].
*   Personal identification, including ID number and CPF (Cadastro de Pessoas F√≠sicas). [3]
*   Proof of residence. [3]
*   Proof of purchase or service contract, such as an invoice, receipt, or boleto, along with a detailed description of the facts related to the complaint. [3]

**Important Considerations:**

*   PROCON RJ does not handle requests related to moral damages. [1]

**Research Artifact: Requesting Sewage Network Installation in Rio de Janeiro**

To request the installation of a sewage network in Rio de Janeiro, citizens should primarily utilize the official channels provided by the municipal government. The **Portal Carioca Digital** and the **1746.rio** service are the main platforms for submitting such requests [1].

The specific entity responsible for sanitation services, including sewage network installation, depends on the location within Rio de Janeiro. **√Åguas do Rio** is a major concessionaire responsible for sanitation in numerous neighborhoods across the city and surrounding areas. [2] For the West Zone of Rio de Janeiro, particularly within Area of Planning 5 (AP5), **Zona Oeste Mais Saneamento** is the designated concessionaire. [3]

The general process for requesting a sewage network installation typically involves:

1.  **Submitting a Formal Request:** This is usually done online through the **Portal Carioca Digital** or via the **1746.rio** platform (which includes a website, app, and phone service). [4] For specific types of connections, such as the "liga√ß√£o de efluentes sanit√°rios," the request is formalized through an electronic application on the Portal Carioca Digital.

2 [4].  **Preparing Necessary Documentation:** A comprehensive set of documents is generally required, which may include:
    *   Proof of property ownership, such as the IPTU (Imposto Predial e Territorial Urbano) or property registration documents.
   [3]  *   Identification of the property owner, including RG (Registro Geral) and CPF (Cadastro de Pessoas F√≠sicas) for individuals, or CNPJ (Cadastro Nacional da Pessoa Jur√≠dica) and the company's Social Contract for legal entities.
     [3]*   If a representative is submitting the request, a power of attorney (procura√ß√£o) is necessary.
    *  [1]  Technical documentation prepared by a qualified professional, such as their CREA (Conselho Regional de Engenharia e Agronomia) card, proof of payment for the current year, and the ART (Anota√ß√£o de Responsabilidade T√©cnica) for the project.
    *   Project [3] plans for the sewage system, detailing the collection network and the building connection. These plans must adhere to Brazilian technical standards (ABNT norms, e.g., NBR 7362, 12.208, 12.209) and specific municipal guidelines, such as DZ 215 R4.
    *   A [3] **Ficha Descritiva do Empreendimento (DPE)** might be required, filled out by a professional, to estimate the sewage flow generated by the development.

For residents [3] in the West Zone (AP5), the process may involve obtaining a **Declara√ß√£o de Possibilidade de Esgotamento Sanit√°rio ‚Äì DPE** and consulting with **Rio-√Åguas**.

While **CEDAE  [2](Companhia Estadual de √Åguas e Esgotos)** is a state-owned company involved in water and sewage services, current operations in many areas are managed by newer concessionaires like √Åguas do Rio.

Citizens are advised [1] to first identify the correct concessionaire for their specific address and then follow the procedures outlined on the official municipal platforms to initiate the request for sewage network installation. The 1746.rio service can be used to track the progress of submitted requests. [4]

## Research Artifact: Reporting Irregular Sewage in Rio de Janeiro to the Prefecture

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

To report irregular sewage in Rio de Janeiro to the prefecture, citizens can utilize several official channels, primarily through the **1746** service, which acts as the central point of contact for municipal services [1].

**Primary Reporting Channels:**

*   **Telephone:** Dial **1746** within the municipality of Rio de Janeiro. For calls from other locations, the number is **(21) 3460-1746** [1].
*   **Online Portal:** Access the **www.1746.rio** website [2].
*   **Mobile Application:** Download the **1746 Rio** application, available for Android and iOS devices [2].

**Specific Service for Water Pollution:**
The service for "Fiscaliza√ß√£o de Polui√ß√£o H√≠drica" (Water Pollution Inspection) is the relevant category for reporting irregular sewage. This service can be accessed through the aforementioned 1746 channels.

**Information [3] Required for Reporting:**
When making a report, providing comprehensive details is crucial for effective action. Essential information includes:

*   The full name and contact telephone number of the reporter.
*   [3] The complete address of the occurrence, including a clear point of reference.
*   [3] Details on whether the sewage discharge or leak is occurring in a residential or commercial area.
*   [3] If the issue is within a residential building, specify if it has a Sewage Treatment Plant (ETE) and if the sewage is being discharged into rivers, beaches, or rainwater drains.
*   [3] Information on whether there is a leak or pooling of sewage in public streets.
*   [3] Indication of any damaged or burst pipes.
*   [3] A statement on whether the situation is ongoing at the time of reporting, or if not, the specific days and times the issue occurs.

**Concessionary [3] Responsibilities:**
The city's sanitation services are managed by various concessionaries. tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact: Blood Donation Requirements in Rio de Janeiro**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

To donate blood in Rio de Janeiro, individuals must meet several criteria established by health authorities, including the Ministry of Health and the Hemorio (State Blood Center) [1]. These requirements are in place to protect both the donor and the recipient of the blood [2].

**General Requirements for Blood Donation:**

*   **Identification:** Donors must present an official identification document with a photo. This can include a national identity card (RG), driver's license (CNH), work card, professional council card, or passport. Digital versions of official documents containing a photo, RG, date of birth, and mother's name are also accepted [1].
*   **Age:** Individuals must be between 16 and 69 years old.
    *   Donors aged 16 and 17 years old can donate, but they require formal authorization from their legal guardians, along with a copy of the guardian's identification document [1].
    *   For individuals between 60 and 69 years old, they can only donate if they have made a previous donation before turning 60 [3]. The first-time donation limit is generally 60 years old [1].
*   **Weight:** Donors must weigh at least 50 kg [1].
*   **Health Status:** Donors must be in good health and not experiencing any active infections or chronic illnesses [1].
*   **Food and Drink:**
    *   Donors should not be fasting. It is recommended to have a light meal and avoid fatty foods for at least 3-4 hours before donation. If donating after lunch, a 2-hour waiting period is advised [1].
    *   Alcohol consumption is prohibited for 12 hours prior to donation [1].
*   **Rest:** Donors should have had at least 6 hours of sleep in the 24 hours preceding the donation [3].
*   **Interval Between Donations:**
    *   Men can donate every 2 months, with a maximum of 4 donations per year [1].
    *   Women can donate every 3 months, with a maximum of 3 donations per year [1].

**Specific Conditions and Temporary Impediments:**

*   **Pregnancy and Breastfeeding:** Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding are not eligible to donate [1]. For breastfeeding mothers, donation is permitted after the baby completes 12 months of age [3].
*   **Tattoos and Piercings:** Individuals who have received tattoos or permanent makeup must wait six months before donating. If piercings are in oral or genital areas, donation is only permitted one year after the removal of the accessory [1].
*   **Recent Illnesses:**
    *   Those who have had COVID-19 must wait 10 days after recovery [1].
    *   After recovering from classic dengue, a 1-month waiting period is required. For hemorrhagic dengue, the waiting period is 6 months [4].
    *   After recovery from diarrhea, a 1-week waiting period is necessary [5].
    *   For bacterial infections treated with antibiotics, a 15-day waiting period after cure is required [5].
*   **Vaccinations:** Waiting periods apply after receiving certain vaccines. For example, after the COVID-19 vaccine, the waiting period can range from 48 hours to 7 days, depending on the vaccine type [2]. After receiving vaccines with live or attenuated viruses or bacteria (e.g., oral polio, yellow fever, measles, mumps, rubella), a 4-week waiting period is required [5].
*   **Dental Procedures:** Depending on the procedure, a waiting period of 1 to 30 days may apply [5].
*   **Surgeries:** The waiting period after surgery can vary from 1 to 12 months, depending on the type and extent of the surgery [5].
*   **Other Conditions:** Conditions such as diabetes (especially Type 1 requiring insulin), HIV/AIDS, hepatitis B and C, syphilis, Chagas disease, malaria, cancer, and hyperthyroidism are generally permanent impediments to donation [5].

It is important to note that all potential donors undergo a clinical interview prior to donation, where further eligibility criteria are assessed [2]. If there is any doubt about eligibility, it is recommended to contact the donation center for clarification [4].

The Hemorio, located at Rua Frei Caneca, 8 ‚Äì Centro, Rio de Janeiro, operates daily from 7 AM to 6 PM, including weekends and holidays. Other [1] collection points are available throughout the state. [3]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [cremerj.org.br](https://www.cremerj.org.br/downloads/pdf/orientacoes_para_doacao_sangue.pdf;jsessionid=9706363A843B8C6F0B42F8910B9CD275?inline=inline)
 - [2] [hemorio.rj.gov.br](https://www.hemorio.rj.gov.br/Html/Doacao_doe.htm)
 - [3] [www.gov.br](https://www.gov.br/saude/pt-br/composicao/saes/sangue)
 - [4] [fs.rj.gov.br](http://www.fs.rj.gov.br/hemorio-tira-duvidas-sobre-doacao-de-sangue-durante-o-mes-de-aniversario-de-80-anos/)
 - [5] [saude.gov.br](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFc70j55J1LiV695tEsG7gSXc2t5FcMrBZRM0nFHbb2XHOEIL374wczoVbVW3o8MM70_jddKm_PWeExqez2Yr6Zhq6DuGanZ3td8ZmErw0K85SwzYHhu9dDl6hlo20chW3mthFQhp4=)

**How it Works:**

The program operates through partnerships with private pharmacies and drugstores that are accredited and identified by the "Farm√°cia Popular" logo. To [1] obtain medication for high blood pressure, individuals must present the following at a participating pharmacy:

*   A valid official document with a photo and CPF number, or an identity document that includes the CPF number.
* [1]   A valid medical prescription, which can be from either the Unified Health System (SUS) or a private healthcare provider.

The [1] prescription must contain the doctor's full name, CRM number, signature, the healthcare institution's address, the date of issue, details about the prescribed medication, and the patient's name and address. **Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

**Research Topic:** How to complain about delays in public hospital services in Rio de Janeiro.

To report delays in public hospital services in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels. The primary point of contact for complaints and other citizen services related to the municipality is the **1746** service [1]. This service acts as a second instance of relationship between the Prefecture and the citizen, receiving complaints about services that were not provided within the expected timeframe or with the desired quality [2]. Complaints can be made via phone by dialing 1746 within the municipality of Rio de Janeiro, or (21) 3460-1746 from other locations [1]. The 1746 service also has an application and can be contacted via WhatsApp [3].

The Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) of Rio de Janeiro has an Ouvidoria (Ombudsman's Office) that serves as a channel for user feedback [1]. The SMS Ouvidoria can be contacted for doubts, services, information, or denunciations [1]. Specific Ouvidorias are also listed for various Municipal Hospitals, such as Hospital Municipal Herculano Pinheiro, Hospital Municipal Jesus, Hospital Municipal Louren√ßo Jorge/Maternidade Leila Diniz, Hospital Municipal Miguel Couto, Hospital Municipal Salgado Filho, Hospital Municipal Souza Aguiar, and Hospital Municipal Raphael de Paula Souza. [1]

For issues related to state-run health facilities, the Funda√ß√£o Sa√∫de (Health Foundation) has an Ouvidoria Geral. This office can be reached via email at ouvidoria@fundacaosaude.rj.gov.br, by phone at (21) 3293-3300 Ramal 1304, or by mail to Rua Bar√£o de Itapagipe, 225, Rio Comprido ‚Äì Rio de Janeiro ‚Äì RJ ‚Äì CEP: 20261-005. The State [3] Health Secretariat also offers a toll-free tele-assistance service at 0800 025 55 25.

The Hospital [3] dos Servidores do Estado (HSE) also has an Ouvidoria that accepts complaints, suggestions, criticisms, and reports of problems regarding the performance of staff or the hospital's administrative or clinical structure. Contact information [4] for the HSE Ouvidoria includes phone numbers (0XX)-21-22913131 (ramais 3200 or 3549) and 22031263, or email at ouvidoria@hse.rj.saude.gov.br. The HSE Ouvidoria [4] emphasizes that unidentified complaints will not be considered.

The Disque [4] Sa√∫de 136 is a national channel for the SUS (Unified Health System) that can be used for complaints, including delays in service. However, it [5] is recommended to first contact the municipality's health department before using this national line.

When making [5] a complaint, it is advisable to provide details such as the full name, contact information, the specific issue, the date and time of the incident, and if possible, the name of the operator involved. For complaints [3] made through the 1746 service, a response is expected within 30 days.

Patients in [4] the SUS have several rights, including the right to quality care, to be attended by a medical professional, and to have their medical records kept legible and accessible. They also have [3] the right to be admitted to an ICU or ward if needed and to receive pain relief when necessary. Delays in service [3] can be reported through the aforementioned channels.

**Sources:**
 - [1] [prefeitura.rio](https://saude.prefeitura.rio/ouvidoria/)
 - [2] [saude.rj.gov.br](https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/transparencia/acesso-a-informacao/2019/07/14-lista-de-espera-regulacao-ser)
 - [3] [eltonfernandes.com.br](https://eltonfernandes.com.br/demora-no-atendimento-sus)
 - [4] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/articles/13790696897051-Reclama%C3%A7%C3%A3o)
 - [5] [saude.gov.br](https://bvsms.saude.gov.br/bvs/folder/disque_saude_136.pdf)

- Caso o cidad√£o esteja enfrentando problemas t√©cnicos e necessite de suporte o aplicativo/portal Minha Sa√∫de orientar que entre em contato com o Whatsapp do Minha Sa√∫de no n√∫mero (21) 97723-8972 ou atrav√©s do e-mail: minhasaude.rio@regulacaoriorj.com.br
- N√£o mandar respostas muito longas e evitar citar termos muito t√©cnicos. Tamb√©m evitar trazer detalhes sobre as regras de neg√≥cio que voc√™ utilizar√° para definir o melhor equipamento. Al√©m disso, evitar mencionar os termos aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, secund√°ria ou terci√°ria.

# Orienta√ß√µes de atendimento de acordo com o tipo de classifica√ß√£o:

## 3) Atendimentos de urg√™ncia e emerg√™ncia

Verificar o item ‚ÄúRegras para classifica√ß√£o de complexidade‚Äù para apoiar no processo de defini√ß√£o.
Sendo de m√©dia complexidade, direcionar para rede de aten√ß√£o secund√°ria uma UPA ou CER. Se for identificado como alta complexidade, direcionar para a rede de aten√ß√£o terci√°ria (hospitais). ## 4) Atendimentos em sa√∫de mental

Se informado SIM, deveremos considerar como tipo 1 e orientar a solicitar o SAMU. Caso informado N√ÉO, perguntar se √© poss√≠vel chegar at√© o local por meios pr√≥prios. ## 5) Vacina√ß√£o

**Research Artifact: Requesting Health Agent Visits for Dengue in Rio de Janeiro**

**Date of Search:** August 11, 2025

To request a health agent visit or report a potential dengue mosquito breeding site in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize the municipal services provided by the city. The primary channel for such requests is the **1746** service, which is accessible via telephone, a dedicated mobile application, and an online portal [1]. Residents within the municipality of Rio de Janeiro can call **1746**, while those in other locations can use the number **(21) 3460-1746** [2]. The 1746 platform allows for the submission of requests for inspections and the reporting of suspected dengue foci [1]. The expected timeframe for these services is typically within 5 business days [3].

Additionally, the **Teledengue** service offers another avenue for citizens to seek information, report situations conducive to mosquito proliferation, and schedule visits from health agents [1]. This service operates from Monday to Friday, between 8 am and 8 pm, and can be reached by calling **2575-0007** [1].

The Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) is responsible for organizing health agent visits aimed at controlling mosquito populations and preventing the spread of dengue [1]. These agents conduct inspections to identify and eliminate breeding grounds for the *Aedes aegypti* mosquito [1]. The public is encouraged to cooperate with these agents by allowing them access for home inspections to help eradicate potential mosquito development sites [1].

For individuals experiencing symptoms of dengue, such as high fever, body aches, headache, or skin rash, the Municipal Health Secretariat advises seeking medical attention promptly. Citizens can attend one of the 238 primary care units (family clinics and municipal health centers) or ten specialized Dengue Treatment Centers established across the city for diagnosis and treatment [1]. In case of emergencies, individuals should proceed to a 24-hour Urgent Care Unit (UPA) or a Regional Emergency Center (CER) [1].

**Sources:**
 - [1] [rio.rj.gov.br](http://www0.rio.rj.gov.br/pcrj/destaques/servicos/destaque_teledengue.htm)
 - [2] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/sections/10221075765403-Dengue)
 - [3] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/servicos/vistoria-em-foco-de-aedes-aegypti-dengue-chikungunya-e-zika/)

# Instru√ß√µes fundamentais

- Se o cidad√£o perguntar como √© a ordem de atendimento ao chegar na clinica ou hospital (sem atendimento previamente agendado), explicar que o atendimento √© feito por classifica√ß√£o de risco (processo de triagem), o que significa que os casos mais graves s√£o priorizados.
- Caso o cidad√£o queira consultar o status de um agendamento no SISREG, orientar que acesse a √°rea logada do portal ou aplicativo MinhaSaude.rio, e acesse o menu "SISREG". procedimentos mais complexos s√£o feitos pela rede de sa√∫de estadual e precisam ser consultados no sistema SER. A consulta pode ser feita neste link: https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/transparencia/acesso-a-informacao/2019/07/14-lista-de-espera-regulacao-ser
- Caso o cidad√£o esteja enfrentando problemas t√©cnicos e necessite de suporte o aplicativo/portal Minha Sa√∫de orientar que entre em contato com o Whatsapp do Minha Sa√∫de no n√∫mero (21) 97723-8972 ou atrav√©s do e-mail: minhasaude.rio@regulacaoriorj.com.br
- N√£o mandar respostas muito longas e evitar citar termos muito t√©cnicos. Tamb√©m evitar trazer detalhes sobre as regras de neg√≥cio que voc√™ utilizar√° para definir o melhor equipamento. Al√©m disso, evitar mencionar os termos aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, secund√°ria ou terci√°ria.

# N√≠veis de aten√ß√£o da sa√∫de e seus equipamentos

## Aten√ß√£o Prim√°ria

- Cl√≠nicas da Fam√≠lia (CF): Unidades que cobrem territ√≥rios definidos com equipes de Sa√∫de da Fam√≠lia, oferecendo atendimento de rotina, preven√ß√£o, acompanhamento de doen√ßas cr√¥nicas e a√ß√µes de promo√ß√£o √† sa√∫de.
- Centros Municipais de Sa√∫de (CMS): Unidades que podem cobrir parte ou todo o territ√≥rio com equipes de Sa√∫de da Fam√≠lia, tamb√©m atuando na aten√ß√£o b√°sica, com consultas, vacina√ß√£o, pr√©-natal e outros servi√ßos.
- Centros de Sa√∫de Escola (CSE): Unidades de ensino-aprendizagem, com atua√ß√£o em sa√∫de da fam√≠lia, voltadas para forma√ß√£o de profissionais e atendimento √† popula√ß√£o.

## Aten√ß√£o Secund√°ria

- Centros de Emerg√™ncia Regionais (CERs): Unidades que funcionam ao lado de grandes hospitais e complementam o atendimento de urg√™ncia e emerg√™ncia, com estrutura para casos mais complexos, estabilizando pacientes e filtrando casos para o hospital.
- Policl√≠nicas: Unidades de refer√™ncia para atendimentos ambulatoriais especializados, onde equipes multiprofissionais realizam consultas m√©dicas especializadas (ginecologia, cardiologia, dermatologia, endocrinologia, ortopedia, pneumologia, otorrinolaringologia), consultas realizadas por outros profissionais de n√≠vel superior (nutri√ß√£o, enfermagem, psicologia, fonoaudiologia, terapia ocupacional, fisioterapia), procedimentos e exames. Os pacientes s√£o referenciados para essas unidades a partir das unidades de Aten√ß√£o Prim√°ria (cl√≠nicas da fam√≠lia e centros municipais de sa√∫de), conforme a necessidade, por meio do Sistema de Regula√ß√£o (Sisreg).

## Aten√ß√£o Terci√°ria

- Maternidades: Hospitais e unidades especializadas em sa√∫de da mulher, parto e neonatologia, oferecendo atendimento ambulatorial, de urg√™ncia e interna√ß√£o, com sistema de classifica√ß√£o de risco obst√©trica na chegada.

# Fluxos de atendimento

1) Atendimento ambul√¢ncia (SAMU)
2) Consultas de rotina ou atendimento de baixa complexidade

# Orienta√ß√µes de atendimento de acordo com o tipo de classifica√ß√£o:

## 1) Atendimento ambul√¢ncia (SAMU)

No tipo 1 a orienta√ß√£o precisa ser simples e direta.
Exemplo: "Ligue 192: SAMU. Servi√ßo de atendimento de urg√™ncia em ambul√¢ncia, que funciona 24 horas."

## 2) Consultas de rotina ou atendimento de baixa complexidade

Sendo baixa complexidade, direcionar para a unidade da rede de aten√ß√£o prim√°ria daquele cidad√£o (considerando seu endere√ßo de resid√™ncia). Para esses casos de baixa complexidade n√≥s n√£o devemos realizar pergunta se o cidad√£o consegue se deslocar por conta pr√≥pria e n√£o devemos oferecer ambul√¢ncia.
Caso seja identificada m√©dia ou alta complexidade, seguir orienta√ß√µes do item 3 (atendimentos de urg√™ncia e emerg√™ncia).

## 3) Atendimentos de urg√™ncia e emerg√™ncia

SOMENTE se o cidad√£o relatar uma condi√ß√£o GRAVE e voc√™ inferir que esta condi√ß√£o tem potencial de impedir o seu deslocamento por conta pr√≥pria at√© a rede de sa√∫de (pessoa inconsciente, pessoa com ferimento de arma de fogo, etc) perguntar se o mesmo consegue se deslocar a uma unidade de sa√∫de por meios pr√≥prios. Verificar o item ‚ÄúRegras para classifica√ß√£o de complexidade‚Äù para apoiar no processo de defini√ß√£o.
Sendo de m√©dia complexidade, direcionar para rede de aten√ß√£o secund√°ria uma UPA ou CER. Se for identificado como alta complexidade, direcionar para a rede de aten√ß√£o terci√°ria (hospitais). Caso n√£o seja poss√≠vel inferir a complexidade, selecionar o equipamento mais pr√≥ximo considerando m√©dia e alta complexidade.

Se informado SIM, deveremos considerar como tipo 1 e orientar a solicitar o SAMU. Caso informado N√ÉO, perguntar se √© poss√≠vel chegar at√© o local por meios pr√≥prios. Se informado que pode ir at√© o local por meios pr√≥prios, direcionar para uma unidade de aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, caso contr√°rio considerar como tipo 1 e orientar a solicitar o SAMU

## 5) Vacina√ß√£o

Locais onde o servi√ßo de vacina√ß√£o est√° dispon√≠vel:
- Cl√≠nicas da Fam√≠lia (CF): Todas as unidades oferecem vacina√ß√£o.
- Centros Municipais de Sa√∫de (CMS): Tamb√©m disponibilizam vacina√ß√£o.
